conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C and D. Predict which container (E or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
A, B, C, and D are the starting points of the liquid.
E and F are the containers that receive the liquid.
Stream B and C strike the red slanted barrier and are deflected to the left together.
Stream D hits the purple slanted barrier and is deflected to the left as well.
Stream A straddles the angle of the black baffle and splits into 2 branches.

premise: Stream B and C strike the red slanted barrier and are deflected to the left together; Stream D hits the purple slanted barrier and is deflected to the left as well.
conclusion: Stream B, C, and D strike the black slanted barrier, merge and are deflected to the right.

premise: Stream A straddles the angle of the black baffle and splits into 2 branches; Stream B, C, and D strike the black slanted barrier, merge and are deflected to the right.
conclusion: The mixture of A, B, and C separate into container E and F equally; stream D ends in container F.
